element.name: EMS Agency Unique State ID
element.definition: The unique ID assigned to the EMS Agency which is associated with all state licensure numbers and information.
element.v3Comment: This may be the EMS Agency Name or a unique number assigned by the state EMS office. This is required to document multiple license types and numbers associated with the same EMS Agency.

element.name: EMS Agency Number
element.definition: The state-assigned provider number of the responding agency
element.v3Comment: This is the primary identifier for the entire Demographic Section. Each of the Demographic sections must be associated with an EMS Agency Number. An EMS Agency can have more than one Agency Number within a state. This reflects the ability for an EMS Agency to have a different number for each service type or location (based on state implementation).

element.name: EMS Agency Name
element.definition: The formal name of the agency.

element.name: EMS Agency State
element.definition: The state/territory which assigned the EMS agency number.
element.v3Comment:
This has been clarified to reflect that it is the state in which the EMS Agency resides and the state associated with the EMS Agency number.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Dispatch Center (CAD) Name or ID
element.definition: The name or ID of the dispatch center providing electronic data to the PCR for the EMS agency, if applicable.
element.v3Comment: This element can be used to identify the dispatch center (Primary or Secondary Service Answering Point - PSAP) that dispatches the EMS agency. If the EMS agency is able to populate the Patient Care Report (PCR) with CAD specific details (times, incident address information, crew information, EMD, etc) the name or ID of the dispatch center should be documented. Information in dConfiguration.17 may be used to populate eDispatch.04 - Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) Name or ID if a CAD integration exists.
element.v3Changes: Added to the dataset to assist in identifying the CAD / dispatch center providing information to the EMS agency and ePCR when there are multiple dispatch centers sending resources to the same EMS incident.

element.name: Patient Care Report Number
element.definition: The unique number automatically assigned by the EMS agency for each Patient Care Report (PCR). This should be a unique number for the EMS agency for all of time.

element.name: EMS Agency Number
element.definition: The state-assigned provider number of the responding agency
element.v3Comment: The EMS Agency Number in eResponse.01 can auto-populate from dAgency.02 EMS Agency Number in the demographic section.

element.name: EMS Agency Name
element.definition: EMS Agency Name
element.v3Comment: Added to better identify the EMS Agency associated with the EMS event.

element.name: Incident Number
element.definition: The incident number assigned by the 911 Dispatch System
element.v3Comment: This number can be used to associate multiple EMS responses, dispatch information, and other information to the same EMS event or patient.

element.name: EMS Response Number
element.definition: The internal EMS response number which is unique for each EMS Vehicle's (Unit) response to an incident within an EMS Agency.

element.name: Type of Service Requested
element.definition: The type of service or category of service requested of the EMS Agency responding for this specific EMS event
element.v3Comment: ?Interfacility Transfer? has been changed to ?Interfacility Transport. ?Public Assistance/Other Not Listed? added for EMS expanded scope events such as elderly assistance, injury prevention, public education, immunization programs, etc.

element.name: Standby Purpose
element.definition: The main reason the EMS Unit is on Standby as the Primary Type of Service for the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: Added to document the reason for ?Standby? when populated in eResponse.05 (Type of Service Requested). This information will assist in administrative analysis of EMS service delivery, special event coverage, etc.

element.name: Primary Role of the Unit
element.definition: The Primary role of the EMS Unit which responded to this specific EMS event
element.v3Comment: Supervisor clarified to Administrative Only. if the Supervisor is responding to assist, that would be considered Non-Transport. Transport separated into Air and Ground. In Version 2 there was no way to identify Air Transport.

element.name: Type of Dispatch Delay
element.definition: The dispatch delays, if any, associated with the dispatch of the EMS unit to the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: A dispatch delay is any time delay that occurs from the time of PSAP call (eTimes.01) to the time the unit is notified by dispatch (eTimes.03).

element.name: Type of Response Delay
element.definition: The response delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.
element.v3Comment:
Rendezvous Transport Unavailable added for situations where there is a wait for an EMS Transport Unit, a Ferry, Air Medical, etc to return to service.
A response delay is any time delay that occurs from the time the unit is notified by dispatch (eTimes.03) to the time the unit arrived on scene (eTimes.06).

element.name: Type of Scene Delay
element.definition: The scene delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: A scene delay is any time delay that occurs from the time the unit arrived on scene (eTimes.06) to the time the unit left the scene (eTimes.09).

element.name: Type of Transport Delay
element.definition: The transport delays, if any, of the EMS unit associated with the EMS event.
element.v3Comment:
Rendezvous Transport Unavailable added for situations where there is a wait for an EMS Transport Unit, a Ferry, Air Medical, etc.
A transport delay is any time delay that occurs from the time the unit left the scene (eTimes.09) to the time the patient arrived at the destination (eTimes.10).

element.name: Type of Turn-Around Delay
element.definition: The turn-around delays, if any, of EMS unit associated with the EMS event.
element.v3Comment:
Rendezvous Transport Unavailable added for situations where there is a wait for an EMS Transport Unit, a Ferry, Air Medical, etc to return to service.
If a patient is being transported by the unit, turn-around delay is any time delay that occurs from the time the patient arrived at the destination (eTimes.10) until the time the unit is back in service (eTimes.13) or unit back at the home location (eTimes15) [whichever is the greater of the two times].
If no patient is being transported by the unit, turn-around delay is any time delay that occurs from the time the unit arrived on scene (eTimes.06) until the unit is back in service (eTimes.13) or the unit back at the home location (eTimes.15) [whichever is the greater of the two times].

element.name: EMS Vehicle (Unit) Number
element.definition: The unique physical vehicle number of the responding unit.
element.v3Comment: This is recommended to be the State Vehicle Permit Number if unique to the vehicle. If the vehicle is not licensed by the state, this should be a unique number only associated with a specific vehicle. This element should be populated from dVehicle.01 - Unit/Vehicle Number.

element.name: EMS Unit Call Sign
element.definition: The EMS unit number used to dispatch and communicate with the unit. This may be the same as the EMS Unit/Vehicle Number in many agencies.
element.v3Comment: "This element could be populated from a list created in dVehicle.03 EMS Unit Call Sign or dConfiguration.16 (Crew Call Sign).

element.name: Level of Care of This Unit
element.definition: The level of care (BLS or ALS) the unit is able to provide based on the units? treatment capabilities for this EMS response.
element.v3Comment:
Added to identify the level of care (license level) the EMS unit/crew can provide regardless of patient need, based on this unit?s capabilities.
For example, if a unit/crew is staffed with an EMT-Intermediate or EMT-Paramedic but the unit is either licensed or stocked at a BLS level the appropriate level of care is "BLS-Basic?. This is because the care provided to patients is limited to BLS skills.

element.name: Vehicle Dispatch Location
element.definition: The EMS Location or healthcare facility name representing the geographic location of the vehicle at the time of dispatch.
element.v3Comment:
This element can be populated from dLocation.02 EMS Location Name or dFacility information. Depending on the information the EMS Agency or State is interested in knowing the following elements can be utilized:
1. dLocation.02 EMS Location Name
2. dFacility.02 Facility Name
3. dFacility.03 Facility Code
4. dFacility.15 Facility GPS Location

element.name: Vehicle Dispatch GPS Location
element.definition: The GPS coordinates associated with the EMS unit at the time of dispatch documented in decimal degrees.
element.v3Comment:
The pattern for GPS location is in the format "latitude,longitude" where:
- latitude has a minimum of -90 and a maximum of 90 with up to 6 decimal places
- longitude has a minimum of -180 and a maximum of 180 with up to 6 decimal places

element.name: Vehicle Dispatch US National Grid Location
element.definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the EMS Vehicle's Dispatch Location.
element.v3Comment: Standard found at www.fgdc.gov/usng. Used by the EMS components of US Governmental entities such as national parks and military agencies.

element.name: Beginning Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
element.definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle at the beginning of the call (when the wheels begin moving). If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)
element.v3Comment: If a mileage counter is being used instead of an odometer, this value would be 0.

element.name: On-Scene Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
element.definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle when it arrives at the scene. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)
element.v3Comment: If using a counter, this is the mileage traveled from dispatch to the scene starting from 0.

element.name: Patient Destination Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
element.definition: The mileage (counter or odometer reading) of the vehicle when it arrives at the patient's destination. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of Boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16 (EMS Transport Method)
element.v3Comment: If using a counter, this is the mileage traveled from dispatch to the patient's transport destination starting from 0.

element.name: Ending Odometer Reading of Responding Vehicle
element.definition: If using a counter, this is the mileage traveled beginning with dispatch through the transport of the patient to their destination and ending when back in service, starting from 0. If EMS vehicle/unit is via water or air travel document the number in "hours" as it relates to the documentation of boat, Fixed Wing, or Rotor Craft in eDisposition.16

element.name: Response Mode to Scene
element.definition: The indication whether the response was emergent or non-emergent. An emergent response is an immediate response (typically using lights and sirens).
element.v3Comment: Information now split between eResponse.21 (Response Mode to Scene) and eResponse.22 (Additional Response Mode Descriptors)

element.name: Additional Response Mode Descriptors
element.definition: The documentation of response mode techniques used for this EMS response.
element.v3Comment: Descriptors have been added to better describe the EMS Response. This includes information on whether the EMS event was schedule or unscheduled.

choice.description: Intersection Navigation-With Automated Light Changing Technology

element.name: Complaint Reported by Dispatch
element.definition: The complaint dispatch reported to the responding unit.
element.v3Comment:
Added Pandemic/Epidemic/Outbreak.
Added Automated Crash Notification
Added Healthcare Professional Admission
Added Interfacility/Evaluation/Transfer
- Other entries expanded based on current national EMD Dispatch List

element.name: EMD Performed
element.definition: Indication of whether Emergency Medical Dispatch was performed for this EMS event.

choice.description: Yes, Unknown if Pre-Arrival Instructions Given

element.name: EMD Card Number
element.definition: The EMD card number reported by dispatch, consisting of the card number, dispatch level, and dispatch mode

element.name: Dispatch Center Name or ID
element.definition: The name or ID of the dispatch center providing electronic data to the PCR for the EMS agency, if applicable.
element.v3Comment: This element can be used to identify the dispatch center (Primary or Secondary Public Safety Answering Point - PSAP) that dispatches the EMS agency. If the EMS agency is able to populate the Patient Care Report (PCR) with CAD specific details (times, incident address information, crew information, EMD, etc) the name or ID of the dispatch center should be documented.
element.v3Changes: Added to the dataset to assist in identifying the CAD / dispatch center providing information to the EMS agency and ePCR when there are multiple dispatch centers sending resources to the same EMS incident.

element.name: Dispatch Priority (Patient Acuity)
element.definition: The actual, apparent, or potential acuity of the patient?s condition as determined through information obtained during the EMD process.
element.v3Comment:
The use of priority and acuity values vary by EMS agency. Some systems may utilize fewer than four priority levels and some more. The use of four priority levels is to capture the majority and allow for the inclusion of the NHTSA National EMS Core Content definitions for patient acuity, specifically: Critical, Emergent, and Lower Acuity.
For EMS Agencies and CAD / EMD systems utilizing Alpha-Echo, Omega levels for determining the priority level for dispatch of the EMS unit, the recommended mapping is:
Echo = Priority 1Charlie = Priority 2Alpha = Priority 3
Delta = Priority 1Bravo = Priority 2Omega = Priority 4
Priority 1 is typically an emergent (lights and sirens) response
Priority 2 is typically an emergent response without the use lights and sirens
Priority 3 is typically a non-emergent response for nursing home, hospital-to-hospital transfers, etc.
Priority 4 is typically a scheduled response (scheduled transfer) or standby event
Definitions related to ?Critical, Emergent, and Lower Acuity? can be found in the National EMS Core Content document from NHTSA EMS (DOT HS 809-898 July 2005) at
http://www.nhtsa.gov/people/injury/ems/emscorecontent/images/EMSCoreContent.pdf

element.name: PSAP Call Date/Time
element.definition: The date/time the phone rings (911 call to public safety answering point or other designated entity) requesting EMS services.
element.v3Comment:
This date/time might be the same as Dispatch Notified Date/Time (eTimes.02).
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Dispatch Notified Date/Time
element.definition: The date/time dispatch was notified by the 911 call taker (if a separate entity).
element.v3Comment:
This date/time might be the same as PSAP Call Date/Time (eTimes.01).
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Dispatch Acknowledged Date/Time
element.definition: The date/time the dispatch was acknowledged by the EMS Unit.
element.v3Comment:
This is the end of turnout time or the beginning of response time. Added per Fire Service to better calculate NFPA 1710.

element.definition: The date/time that patient care was transferred to the destination healthcare facilities staff.
element.v3Comment:
This was added to better document delays in ED transfer of care due to ED crowding or other issues beyond EMS control.

element.v3Comment:
This date/time is to be documented if the unit went en route but neither arrived on scene nor made patient contact.

'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Unit Back at Home Location Date/Time
element.definition: The date/time the responding unit was back in their service area. With agencies who utilized Agency Status Management, home location means the service area as assigned through the agency status management protocol.
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: EMS Call Completed Date/Time
element.definition: The date/time the responding unit completed all tasks associated with the event including transfer of the patient, and such things as cleaning and restocking.
element.v3Comment:
For many EMS agencies, this would equal Unit Back in Service Date/Time (eTimes.13) if no travel is required to be back in service.
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: EMS Patient ID
element.definition: The unique ID for the patient within the Agency
element.v3Comment: This has been inserted to allow each patient to be tracked across multiple PCRs within an EMS Agency.

element.name: Last Name
element.definition: The patient's last (family) name
element.v3Comment: Pertinent negatives accepted with option of "Unable to Complete" or "Refused".

element.name: First Name
element.definition: The patient's first (given) name
element.v3Comment: Pertinent negatives accepted with option of "Unable to Complete" or "Refused".

element.name: Middle Initial/Name
element.definition: The patient's middle name, if any

element.name: Patient's Home Address
element.definition: The patient's home mailing or street address
element.v3Comment: This is a CMS standard. According to the Medicare Claims Processing Manual, Chapter 15 - Ambulance, Ambulance suppliers bill using CMS-1500 form or CMS-1450 form for institution-based ambulance providers. This standard adheres to CMS-1500 and 1450.

element.name: Patient's Home City
element.definition: The patient's home city or township or residence
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Patient's Home County
element.definition: The patient's home county or parish or residence
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ANSI Code Single Choice based on the County Name but stored as the ANSI code (combined 5 digit State and County codes) Should be required if there is a patient associated with the event.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Patient's Home State
element.definition: The patient's home state, territory, or province, or District of Columbia, where the patient resides.
element.v3Comment:
The ANSI Code Selection by text but stored as ANSI code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Patient's Home ZIP Code
element.definition: The patient's home ZIP code of residence
element.v3Comment:
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Patient's Home Country
element.definition: The country in which the patient lives.
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ISO Country Code.
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm

element.name: Patient Home Census Tract
element.definition: The census tract in which the patient lives
element.v3Comment: Census Tract Data Website (files and descriptions): http://www.census.gov/geo/www/2010census/tract_rel/tract_rel.html

element.name: Social Security Number
element.definition: The patient's social security number

element.name: Gender
element.definition: The Patient's Gender

element.name: Race
element.definition: The patient's race as defined by the OMB (US Office of Management and Budget)
element.v3Comment:
OMB requirements are provided at: http://www.omhrc.gov/templates/browse.aspx?lvl=2&lvlID=172. Using single multiple choice question methodology to improve the completion of ethnicity information.
Ethnicity (Version 2.2.1: E06_13) has been merged with this data element and retired.

choice.description: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

element.name: Age
element.definition: The patient's age (either calculated from date of birth or best approximation)

element.name: Age Units
element.definition: The unit used to define the patient's age

element.name: Date of Birth
element.definition: The patient's date of birth

element.name: Patient's Phone Number
element.definition: The patient's home or primary phone number

element.name: First EMS Unit on Scene
element.definition: Documentation that this EMS Unit was the first EMS Unit for the EMS Agency on the Scene
element.v3Comment: Added to improve the evaluation of Response Times when multiple EMS units are responding to the same scene.

element.name: Other EMS or Public Safety Agencies at Scene
element.definition: Other EMS agency names that were at the scene, if any

element.name: Other EMS or Public Safety Agency ID Number
element.definition: The ID number for the EMS Agency or Other Public Safety listed in eScene.02
element.v3Comment: The ID should be the state ID (license number) for the EMS agency or ID number for the law enforcement. This may be an ID assigned by the state or created by the EMS agency.

element.name: Type of Other Service at Scene
element.definition: The type of public safety or EMS service associated with Other Agencies on Scene
element.v3Comment: Associated with each Other Service in eScene.02

element.name: Date/Time Initial Responder Arrived on Scene
element.definition: The time that the initial responder arrived on the scene, if applicable.
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Number of Patients at Scene
element.definition: Indicator of how many total patients were at the scene

element.name: Mass Casualty Incident
element.definition: Indicator if this event would be considered a mass casualty incident (overwhelmed existing EMS resources)

element.name: Triage Classification for MCI Patient
element.definition: The color associated with the initial triage assessment/classification of the MCI patient.
element.v3Comment:
This element is documented when eScene.07 (Mass Casualty Incident) = Yes.
Examples of triage systems include START and SALT.
Adapted from: SALT mass casualty triage: concept endorsed by the American College of Emergency Physicians, American College of Surgeons Committee on Trauma, American Trauma Society, National Association of EMS Physicians, National Disaster Life Support Education Consortium, and State and Territorial Injury Prevention Directors Association. Disaster Med Public Health Prep. 2008 Dec;2(4):245-6.
START reference: Benson M, Koenig KL, Schultz CH. Disaster triage: START, then SAVE-a new method of dynamic triage for victims of a catastrophic earthquake. Prehospital Disaster Med. 1996; Apr-Jun; 11(2): 117-24

element.name: Incident Location Type
element.definition: The kind of location where the incident happened
element.v3Comment:
Code list is represented in ICD-10-CM: Place of Occurrence of the external cause (Y92.0-Y92.9).
ICD-10-CM
Website - http://uts.nlm.nih.gov
Product - UMLS Metathesaurus

element.name: Incident Facility Code
element.definition: The state, regulatory, or other unique number (code) associated with the facility if the Incident is a Healthcare Facility.
element.v3Comment: This may be populated from a list created within dFacility.03 (Facility Location Code) or dFacility.05 (Facility National Provider Identifier).

element.name: Scene GPS Location
element.definition: The GPS coordinates associated with the Scene.
element.v3Comment:
The pattern for GPS location is in the format "latitude,longitude" where:
- latitude has a minimum of -90 and a maximum of 90 with up to 6 decimal places
- longitude has a minimum of -180 and a maximum of 180 with up to 6 decimal places

element.name: Scene US National Grid Coordinates
element.definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the Scene.
element.v3Comment: Standard found at www.fgdc.gov/usng

element.name: Incident Facility or Location Name
element.definition: The name of the facility, business, building, etc. associated with the scene of the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: This element may be populated from a list created within dFacility.02 (Facility Name).

element.name: Mile Post or Major Roadway
element.definition: The mile post or major roadway associated with the incident locations

element.name: Incident Street Address
element.definition: ?The street address where the patient was found, or, if no patient, the address to which the unit responded.?
element.v3Comment: This is a CMS standard. According to the Medicare Claims Processing Manual, Chapter 15 - Ambulance, Ambulance suppliers bill using CMS-1500 form or CMS-1450 form for institution-based ambulance providers.

element.name: Incident Apartment, Suite, or Room
element.definition: The number of the specific apartment, suite, or room where the incident occurred.

element.name: Incident City
element.definition: The city or township (if applicable) where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Incident State
element.definition: The state, territory, or province where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ANSI State Code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Incident ZIP Code
element.definition: The ZIP code of the incident location
element.v3Comment:
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Scene Cross Street or Directions
element.definition: The nearest cross street to the incident address or directions from a recognized landmark or the second street name of an intersection.
element.v3Changes: Added to better locate/document the scene (incident) location.

element.name: Incident County
element.definition: The county or parish where the patient was found or to which the unit responded (or best approximation)
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ANSI Code Single Choice based on the County Name but stored as the ANSI code (combined 5 digit State and County codes) Should be required if there is a patient associated with the event.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Incident Country
element.definition: The country of the incident location.
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ISO Country Code.
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm

element.name: Incident Census Tract
element.definition: The census tract in which the incident occurred.
element.v3Comment: Census Tract Data Website (files and descriptions): http://www.census.gov/geo/www/2010census/tract_rel/tract_rel.html
element.v3Changes: Added to improve the ability to use census and other demographic information within EMS research.

element.name: Destination/Transferred To, Name
element.definition: The destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment: Recommended State data element since no national code for destination. May be populated from the list in dFacility.02 (Facility Name).

element.name: Destination/Transferred To, Code
element.definition: The code of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment: May be populated from list in dFacility.03 (Facility Location Code) or dFacility.05 (Facility National Provider Identifier) if a health care facility. NPI codes can be found on the NEMSIS SharePoint site.

element.name: Destination Street Address
element.definition: The street address of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment: May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.07 (Facility Street Address).

element.name: Destination City
element.definition: The city name of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place code. May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.08 (Facility City).
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Destination State
element.definition: The state of the destination the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ANSI Code. May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.09 (Facility State).
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Destination County
element.definition: The destination county in which the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment:
May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.11 (Facility County). Based on the ANSI Code Single Choice based on the County Name but stored as the ANSI code (combined 5 digit State and County codes) Should be required if there is a patient associated with the event.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Destination ZIP Code
element.definition: The destination ZIP code in which the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment:
May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.10 (Facility ZIP Code).
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Destination Country
element.definition: The country of the destination.
element.v3Comment:
May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.12 (Facility Country).
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm

element.name: Destination GPS Location
element.definition: The destination GPS Coordinates to which the patient was delivered or transferred to.
element.v3Comment:
May be auto-populated if list created in dFacility.13 (Facility GPS Location).
The pattern for GPS location is in the format "latitude,longitude" where:
- latitude has a minimum of -90 and a maximum of 90 with up to 6 decimal places
- longitude has a minimum of -180 and a maximum of 180 with up to 6 decimal places

element.name: Disposition Location US National Grid Coordinates
element.definition: The US National Grid Coordinates for the Disposition Location. This may be the Healthcare Facility US National Grid Coordinates.
element.v3Comment:
Standard found at www.fgdc.gov/usng.
Through programming this may be partially auto-populated if the list is created in dFacility.14 (Facility US National Grid Coordinates).

element.name: Number of Patients Transported in this EMS Unit
element.definition: The number of patients transported by this EMS crew and unit.
element.v3Comment: Added to document multiple patients being transported with the same vehicle and crew.
element.v3Changes: Added to document multiple patients being transported with the same vehicle and crew.

element.name: EMS Transport Method
element.definition: Transport method by this EMS Unit.
element.v3Comment: Required if the patient is transported by EMS.
element.v3Changes: Added to better describe Air and Ground Transport methods.

element.name: Transport Mode from Scene
element.definition: Indication whether the transport was emergent or non-emergent.
element.v3Comment: Information now split between eDisposition.17 (Transport Mode from Scene) and eDisposition.18 (Additional Transport Mode Descriptors). Element eDisposition.18 (Additional Transport Mode Descriptors) has been added to document the use of lights and sirens or other descriptive information.

element.name: Additional Transport Mode Descriptors
element.definition: The documentation of transport mode techniques for this EMS response.
element.v3Comment: Information now split between eDisposition.17 (Transport Mode from Scene) and eDisposition.18 (Additional Transport Mode Descriptors). Element eDisposition.18 (Additional Transport Mode Descriptors) has been added to document the use of lights and sirens or other descriptive information.

choice.description: Intersection Navigation-With Automated Light Changing Technology

element.name: Type of Destination
element.definition: The type of destination the patient was delivered or transferred to
element.v3Comment: Required if Patient Transported by EMS. ?Hospital-In Patient Bed? includes any location in the hospital except the Emergency Department. Choices include those in eDisposition.22 (Hospital In-Patient Destination).

element.name: Destination Team Pre-Arrival Activation
element.definition: Activation of the Destination Healthcare Facility Team prior to EMS arrival for acute ill or injured patient.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document performance measure for acute time dependent illness and injury systems of care.

element.name: Date/Time of Destination Prearrival Activation
element.definition: Date/Time EMS Notified/Activated the Destination Healthcare Facility Team prior to EMS arrival for acute ill or injured patient.
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration
element.v3Changes: Added to better document performance measure for acute time dependent illness and injury systems of care.

element.name: Custom Data Element Title
element.definition: This is the title of the custom data element created to collect information that is not defined formally in NEMSIS Version 3.
element.v3Comment: This is grouped with all data elements in this section and can have multiple instances.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Definition
element.definition: The definition of the custom element and how it should be used.

element.name: Custom Data Type
element.definition: The data type of the custom element.

element.name: Custom Data Element Recurrence
element.definition: Indication if the data element will accept multiple values.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Usage
element.definition: The Usage (Mandatory, Required, or Optional) for the Custom Data Element.
element.v3Comment:
Mandatory = Must be completed and will not accept null values
Required = Must be completed but will accept null values
Optional = Not required but if collected, it cannot be a null value.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Potential Values
element.definition: The values which are associated with the Custom Data Element. Values would be the choices provided to the user when they document the Custom Data Element
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Result
element.definition: The actual value or values chosen (if values listed in custom.05) or result (free text, Date/Time, or number) documented for the Custom Data Element
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Reference
element.definition: Refers to the data element being extended by referencing the correlationID attribute in the element eCustomConfiguration.CustomGroup

element.name: Custom Correlation ID
element.definition: Correlation id used to map back to set of other elements in other sections.
